topquizbackend

Class QuestionBank

  • java.lang.Object
    • topquizbackend.QuestionBank

  • public class QuestionBank
extends java.lang.Object
    The QuestionBank class is used by the front-end classes and packages as a means of accessing many of the objects detailed in the topquizbackend package. QuestionBank maintains all the Questions for a given quiz as well as the currentScore for that quiz, as well as possesses methods for not only de/serialization of Questions from any .ser file containing Questions (stored in an ArrayList), but also methods for writing and reading from results from a text file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuestionBank

        public QuestionBank()
        Base Constructor. This method is not advisable to use as it does not automatically populate the bank of Questions.

      • QuestionBank

        public QuestionBank(java.lang.String filename)
        Robust Constructor for QuestionBank. The filename given should be of type .ser and contain a serialized ArrayList of Question objects, for proper functionality. This Constructor not only populates the bank attribute of this class, but also randomizes the order of Questions within the bank, so that no two QuestionBank objects will have the same order of Questions, even if they're created using the same .ser file
        Parameters:
        filename - String containing the name of the .ser file to be used for populating the QuestionBank's bank of Questions with

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentScore

        public int getCurrentScore()
        Returns:
        the currentScore

      • getBank

        public java.util.ArrayList<Question> getBank()
        Returns:
        the bank

      • setCurrentScore

        public void setCurrentScore(int currentScore)
        Parameters:
        currentScore - the currentScore to set

      • addPoints

        public void addPoints(int points)
        This method is used to add points to the user's curretnScore. The parameter must be non-negative for points to be added
        Parameters:
        points - the non-negative integer of how many points to add to the user's current score

      • addNewQuestion

        public void addNewQuestion(Question newQuestion)
        Method for adding Questions to the QuestionBank's ArrayList of questions; bank.
        Parameters:
        newQuestion - the Question to be added to the bank ArrayList

      • popQuestion

        public Question popQuestion()
        This method checks whether the QuestionBank has Questions remaining in the bank. If so, it removes the Question from the head of the bank ArrayList, updates the ArrayList to edit all the indexes, and returns the former-head Question.
        Returns:
        Question object from the head of the bank ArrayList

      • populateQuestionBank

        public void populateQuestionBank(java.lang.String filename)
        This method takes the .ser filename pased as a parameter and extracts from that .ser file the ArrayList of Question objects. Using that ArrayList, it populates the bank with Questions. Note: There are try-catch blocks in this method to catch the most probable exceptions and fail with grace.
        Parameters:
        filename - String containing the name of the .ser file to be used for populating the QuestionBank's bank of Questions with

      • storeQuestionBank

        public void storeQuestionBank(java.lang.String filename)
        This method stores the ArrayList of Questions, bank, in a .ser file specified by the filename parameter. Note: There are try-catch blocks in this method to catch the most probable exceptions and fail with grace
        Parameters:
        filename - String continaing the name of the .ser file the QuestionBank's bank will be stored to.

      • storeQuizResult

        public void storeQuizResult(java.lang.String filename,
                            java.lang.String testerName,
                            java.time.LocalDateTime currentTime)
        This method appends the latter two parameters as well as the QuestionBank's currentScore to the end of the file specified by the filename parameters This method is used for storing the quiz result to the end of the results.txt file. It stores the quiz-taker's name, their score, and the time at which they completed the quiz. Note: There are try-catch blocks in this method to catch the most probable exceptions and fail with grace
        Parameters:
        filename - String of the filename to which the quiz result will be appended
        testerName - String of the quiz-taker's name
        currentTime - LocalDateTime of when the quiz-taker finished their quiz

      • retrieveQuizResults

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> retrieveQuizResults(java.lang.String filename)
        This method is used to retrieve all quiz-results from the specified file and return them as an ArrayList of Strings. Note: There are try-catch blocks in this method to catch the most probable exceptions and fail with grace
        Parameters:
        filename - String of the file containing all previous quiz-results
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Strings all previous quiz-results from the specified file
